publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-107 Cathie Craigie: Antonine Centre—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of the Antonine Centre at Cumbernauld town centre; congratulates all those who worked so hard to see this development come to fruition; recognises the investment in Cumbernauld and Kilsyth which the Antonine Centre promises; welcomes the new jobs being created through this development; recognises the success of the partnership approach taken by developers, the local authority, Cumbernauld College and local employment agencies; celebrates the huge expansion of new retail opportunities in the Cumbernauld town centre and Wardpark areas, and recognises such developments as a renaissance for the entire Cumbernauld and Kilsyth community.

S3M-107 Cathie Craigie: Antonine Centre—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of the Antonine Centre at Cumbernauld town centre; congratulates all those who worked so hard to see this development come to fruition; recognises the investment in Cumbernauld and Kilsyth which the Antonine Centre promises; welcomes the new jobs being created through this development; recognises the success of the partnership approach taken by developers, the local authority, Cumbernauld College and local employment agencies; celebrates the huge expansion of new retail opportunities in the Cumbernauld town centre and Wardpark areas, and recognises such developments as a renaissance for the entire Cumbernauld and Kilsyth community.

S3M-107 Cathie Craigie: Antonine Centre—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of the Antonine Centre at Cumbernauld town centre; congratulates all those who worked so hard to see this development come to fruition; recognises the investment in Cumbernauld and Kilsyth which the Antonine Centre promises; welcomes the new jobs being created through this development; recognises the success of the partnership approach taken by developers, the local authority, Cumbernauld College and local employment agencies; celebrates the huge expansion of new retail opportunities in the Cumbernauld town centre and Wardpark areas, and recognises such developments as a renaissance for the entire Cumbernauld and Kilsyth community. Supported by: Johann Lamont*, Patricia Ferguson*, Bill Butler*, Elaine Smith*, Jackie Baillie*

S3M-107 Cathie Craigie: Antonine Centre—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of the Antonine Centre at Cumbernauld town centre; congratulates all those who worked so hard to see this development come to fruition; recognises the investment in Cumbernauld and Kilsyth which the Antonine Centre promises; welcomes the new jobs being created through this development; recognises the success of the partnership approach taken by developers, the local authority, Cumbernauld College and local employment agencies; celebrates the huge expansion of new retail opportunities in the Cumbernauld town centre and Wardpark areas, and recognises such developments as a renaissance for the entire Cumbernauld and Kilsyth community. Supported by: Iain Gray*, Karen Gillon*, Jamie Hepburn*, Michael McMahon*
S3M-107 Antonine Centre (lodged on 31 May 2007) Trish Godman*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-107 Antonine Centre (lodged on 31 May 2007) Mr Frank McAveety*, Karen Whitefield*
S3M-107 Antonine Centre (lodged on 31 May 2007) Hugh Henry*
